Detailed Description

Contains functions for manipulating a symtable structure.

Author:
Trevor Williams (trevorw@charter.net)
Date:
1/3/2002

Function Documentation

symtable* symtable_add (  char *    sym,
signal *    sig,
symtable **    symtab
) 
 

Creates a new symtable entry and adds it to the specified symbol table.

Parameters:
sym  VCD symbol for the specified signal.
sig  Pointer to signal corresponding to the specified symbol.
symtab  Pointer to symtable to store the symtable entry to.
Returns:
Returns pointer to newly created symtable entry.
Using the symbol as a unique ID, creates a new symtable element for specified information and places it into the binary tree.

void symtable_assign (  symtable *    symtab ) 
 

Assigns stored values to all associated signals stored in specified symbol table.

Parameters:
symtab  Root of the symtable to assign values to.
Recursively traverses entire symtable tree, assigning stored string value to the stored signal.

void symtable_dealloc (  symtable *    symtab ) 
 

Deallocates all symtable entries for specified symbol table.

Parameters:
symtab  Pointer to root of symtable to clear.
Recursively deallocates all elements of specifies symbol table.

symtable* symtable_find (  char *    sym,
symtable *    symtab,
int    skip
) 
 

Finds specified symbol in specified symbol table and returns pointer to signal.

Parameters:
sym  Name of symbol to find in the table.
symtab  Root of the symtable to search in.
skip  Number of matching symbol values to skip.
Returns:
Returns pointer to found symtable entry or NULL if unable to find.
Performs a binary search of the specified tree to find matching symtable entry. If a match is found,returns a pointer to the found symtable entry; otherwise, returns a value of NULL to indicate that the symtable entry was not found.
